Happy birthday!
Why thank you. I’m catching up to Henry
Happy birthday Dana! :birthday:
I had cake for breakfast, because fuck you, body.
It's your body...bury it in fat to show it who's boss.
Apropos of nothing, while watching some of the holiday Vintage Cube drafts it was interesting to see [[Chart a Course]] show up.

text: Blue's Night's Whisper

Thanks in part to you Dana, I'm actually considering changing up my Apostles build by going down some Apostles and up Night's Whisper, Sign in Blood, and maybe Altar's Reap, Costly Plunder, Read the Bones and Succumb to Temptation
I agree with <@U4V5EHQ2G> - you won't have many games where you lament drawing cards.

This would be a pretty drastic change for the deck, but I've realized that the deck has a problem. It either draws an engine and explodes, or it stalls until it draws into 6 Apostles or an engine piece.
Yeah, Henry, I've come to see that.
I've come to realize that drawing helps you achieve the deck's goal more consistently vs. taking away.
Right.
It's a tough mindset to change, though...
Though making this change will make Thrumming Stone worse, I think it will make the deck better overall.
Draw just spackles over so many problems
But drawing into card draw is only going to draw me into more draw or Apostles, so win win
I realized I still don't have enough draw in Elendra....need to go up Necropotence
I played Thrumming Stone wrong forever and didn’t realize the tiggers stacked
Dean, that is one of the reasons I have so few rats in relentless rats, any more nights make the thrumming stone better but it hampers the deck too much to put more in
With enough draw you get to cast more of the creatures and other things
Right.
Honestly Necrop probably should b banned

The other thing I'm thinking about is going up a land or two. Another big change. The curve of the deck is so low that it regularly functions fine with just 31 lands, but taking out Apostles for cheap draw might necessitate adding a land.
I guess the trip black limits the decks it can go in but still
Yeah...Elenda has enough incidental lifegain to easily offset any Necropotence greed I may feed...
It worth putting in most two color decks with black
Even if you just use it once it’s almost always worth
Oh it is; the problem is ensuring you don't have to discard a lot since she's a gy deck...that gets nasty :wink:
but live by the sword...

<https://www.mtggoldfish.com/articles/intro-to-pauper-finance>

Well this is a thing now

attachments.title: Intro to Pauper Finance
attachments.text: Pauper is taking off in the paper world. What does this mean from a finance perspective? Let's break it down!

text: My initial reaction is he makes the graphs look like the prices have skyrocketed, but really the deck cost has gone from $46 to $52...
This is super misleading
oh wow, that’s like graphs 101 on how to mislead people
He's an idiot
Math checks out.
Sometimes I wish I didn't put my real name on everything so I could call people out for being idiots more

The format is really fun, we've had 15+ people show up on a Saturday evening both weekends we've ran events at our LGS and that's just the first 2 events. The gameplay is fun and easy to process since everything happens on the battlefield. Honestly the last thing people need to is for someone to start a frenzy about needing to buy up all the cards for all the decks now.
Pauper looks like a more open-ended format than modern. I'd try it.
If you like creatures bouncing off each other than yea, it's great

It's like what Tiny Leaders was trying to do, except this is more on the modern/legacy axis than the EDH one. The removal and hand disruption SUCKS so there's lots of creatures out for most decks but it's not too complex or overwhelming
Elves and affinity are the most complex decks, but affinity is just always having to count how many artifacts you have at the moment
I’ve always been a fan of the Kuldotha variants, and the Tortured Existence decks. I’ve never committed to a deck in paper, but those would be the two
The kuldotha decks are super fast. People that don't understand why the artifact lands are banned in modern just need to play pauper for a bit to see why
Then imagine that with [[cranial plating]] and [[arcbound ravager]]

text: Yea, that card is silly expensive
It's on the RL isn't it?
arabian niiiiighhts
like ariabians days, it’s hotter than hot
What's the combo or is it the fact it's used as a removal spell?
it goes into mono black control
you run that, playset of gary, some number of pesiltlence
gary is your five mana finisher
you also get to run your common discard spells
Not on the RL
I've always wanted to play kiln fiend and /or delver
I guess I could run faceless butcher in the same slot, but it’s a turn slower and weak to more things
And ll of my favorite cantrips are legal!
yeah, cantrip burn seems really strong to me in pauper
Yea man, that's why I wanted to play Kiln fiend. A decent modern deck with legacy quality cantrips? Sign me up.
Delver decks are too grindy for me. That playstyle isn't my thing, I like being more proactive.
[[thermo-alchemist]] just seems so good when paired with brainstorm, ponder, bolt….

text: It's in the burn lists and is pretty good. It's a decent blocker
That and some archer from Amonkhet both are sweet for the burn decks
man, I need a new playmat
I need a new playmat like I need a shotgun blast to the face
so, a lot?
I only have one and it’s getting raggy as hell
I have been using my brainstorm brewery mat for years and I keep accumulating other ones
I got my current one in the first reddit mtg secret santa
<@U32LRG9NU> do a giveaway
especially a paetreon one
"Win a playmat I've never used."
new bussiness model “playmats 4 cards”
it’s like cash4gold but worse somehow
Puca had a playmats for cards thing for a while
So you know if they did it it must be a great business model
I just like the idea of trading in this context in that you’re using two secondary currencies to trade instead of using the primary, which is a bit unusual for the normal person
It’s called bartering and it’s barbaric :joy:
the thing about bartering is that there is no need for a primary currency
r/libertarians is leaking
blar blar blar people are going to donate the money needed to take care of roads and not just the bare minimum needed to feel good about themselves
The prof is rambling about how Wizards needs to print Pauper dual decks. Aren’t they already like 3 cards away from being pauper decks?
What a fucking idiot
The prof is rambling about how Wizards needs to print Pauper dual decks. Aren’t they already like 3 cards away from being pauper decks?
Just open 3 masters set packs and you have 2/3 the format...
The prof is rambling about how Wizards needs to print Pauper dual decks. Aren’t they already like 3 cards away from being pauper decks?
Dana is rambling about how the prof is rambling
Dana is caught in a hate spiral. I've seen it before many times

Just seems a bizarre thing for him to spend 10 tweets on. I mean yeah they could not include Geist of St Traft in a dual deck and I guess that would save pauper people from having to replace it w a healing salve or whatever secret tech they run but does he really think doing so and making it unattractive to literally everyone else is logical?
Birthday hate spiral. I’m the same age my dad was when he dropped me off for college
How’s the for positivity; been at the DMV less than ten min and my number is next
To play devil's advocate, Evan Erwin first threw out the Pauper duel deck idea. But the prof did run with it
What next? "Pauper Masters?"
*shudder*
Probably
Or they can just keep making good masters sets and it just happens organically. Or people can shout their support for the format with silly ideas
Paper pauper people punctuate their playing with a petition for proper format provisions.
Am I doing this right?
I present a proposal...
Poopoo on personalities of prominence who parlay their personality on improbable petitions
Professor poops pauper proposal using presidents preferred podium
it’s a silly argument that they should make product for pauper
Yup
I mean, the core argument of “we need reprints of expensive cards ” is fine
They already make pauper product: everything
You could say the same of EDH, though.
true, but we also get rarities across the board printed
it also turns pauper into a “legacy lite” format
which we already have like a dozen of

They said a few times that they intentionally shift cards to common for pauper purposes in masters type sets. Seeker of the Way went to common in Iconic, Drake got moved to common because they wanted to experiment with the format etc
commons also have way more chances to be printed in the first place
